choices.text:
### System:
You are an AI assistant that follows instruction extremely well. Help as much as you can.

### User:
why does this command give error Permission denied (publickey):

ssh -i \“~/UserKey.pem" -C -L 25900:localhost:5900 ec2-34-221-131-108.us-west-2.compute.amazonaws.com

### Response:


The command is trying to establish an SSH connection from your local machine to a remote EC2 instance using the public key authentication method. However, it fails with the error message "Permission denied (publickey)", which means that the permissions on the private key file and/or the authorized_keys file are incorrect. 

To resolve this issue, make sure that you have the necessary permissions to access the private key file and authorized_keys file. You can also try running the command with the -v flag to see more detailed error messages. Additionally, you can refer to the Amazon Web Services documentation for more information on how to set up SSH connections and public key authentication: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/using-ssh-to-connect-to-your-instance.html
